verse.roman:
diṣṭyā pāpo hataḥ kaṁsaḥ
sānugo vām idaṁ kulam
bhavadbhyām uddhṛtaṁ kṛcchrād
durantāc ca samedhitam

synonyms: diṣṭyā—by good fortune; pāpaḥ—sinful; hataḥ—killed; sa-anugaḥ—together with his brothers and other followers; vām—of Yours; idam—this; kulam—dynasty; bhavadbhyām—by You two; uddhṛtam—delivered; kṛcchrāt—from difficulty; durantāt—endless; ca—and; samedhitam—made prosperous.
translation: [Akrūra said:] It is our good fortune that You two Lords have killed the evil Kaṁsa and his followers, thus delivering Your dynasty from endless suffering and causing it to flourish.
